_exec_summary.SummaryText:
A.  Describe the Accident Release Prevention and Emergency Policies



It is the intent of J.R. Simplot Company to provide a safe work environment for every employee and to protect them from injury and illness resulting from unsafe acts or conditions during hours of employment.  J.R. Simplot will also comply with all federal, state and local laws.  The Unit Director has the responsibility for leadership of the safety and health program, for its effectiveness and improvement and for providing the safeguards required to ensure safe conditions.



Ammonia safety programs are key items in the plant safety and health program.  J.R. Simplot takes many precautions to prevent or minimize accidental releases of ammonia.  These precautions include safety controls (alarms and automatic shutdown devices) which are designed to identify and prevent potentially unsafe conditions like pressure increase that could cause a system failure, a preventive maintenance program designed to maintain the on-going integrity of the systems.  A training program designed to ensure that the systems are operated by qualified personnel, and emergency action procedures which enable trained personnel to respond quickly to system upsets.



The Boiler and Refrigeration Supervisor is responsible for the management of the ammonia safety programs.



B.  Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled



J.R. Simplot Company Grand Forks Potato Plant produces frozen potato products for sale to the public.  The facility operates an ammonia refrigeration system to cool and freeze the food products and the production areas.  The maximum ammonia inventory at the plant is approximately 90,000 pounds.  Ammonia is the only regulated substance handled at the Grand Forks Plant.



C.  Description of the Accidental Release Prevention Program



The facility has a program level 3 accident release prevention program for the ammonia system that complies with OSHA's Process Safety Management Standard and EPA's Risk M

anagement Program Regulation.  The ammonia prevention program consists of the following elements:



A?    Employee Participation Program

A?    Process Safety Information

A?    Process Hazard Analysis

A?    Operating Procedures

A?    Training Program

A?    Contractor Safety Program

A?    Pre-Startup Safety Review Procedures

A?    Mechanical Integrity Program

A?    Hot Work Permit Procedures

A?    Management of Change Procedures

A?    Incident Investigation Procedures

A?    Compliance Audit Procedures



D.  Five-Year Accident History



There have not been any ammonia-related incidents at the Grand Forks Plant during the previous five years that resulted in significant on-site or offsite consequences.



E.  Description of the Emergency Response Program



This facility does not have an Emergency Response Plan but does have an Emergency Action Plan.  This program contains procedures describing how the facility will respond to fires, ammonia leaks and other emergencies, including evacuation procedures.



The Emergency Action Plan includes the following elements:



A?    Fire Plan

A?    Ammonia Leak Procedures

A?    Evacuation Procedures



F. Planned Changes to Improve Safety



In 2019, Simplot personnel began a thorough review to update and detail all SOP's for Ammonia and Refrigeration equipment and other related entities.
